SEARCH
Package blockchain

Class MinerNode

java.lang.Object
blockchain.MinerNode
public class MinerNode extends Object
Represents a node in a blockchain network that mines blocks and handles communications with clients and peers.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes

    Class

    private class 
    MinerNode.MiningThread
    Returns the blockchain maintained by this node.

  • Constructor Details

    • MinerNode

      public MinerNode(int clientPort, int peerNodePort, List<String> peerAddresses, int myIndex, int difficulty) throws IOException
      Constructs a MinerNode with specified ports, peer addresses, index, and mining difficulty. Initializes blockchain and sets up server sockets for client and peer communications.
      Parameters:
      clientPort - Port number for client communications.
      peerNodePort - Port number for communications with other nodes.
      peerAddresses - List of addresses of peer nodes.
      myIndex - Index of this node in the list of peers.
      difficulty - Mining difficulty setting for the blockchain.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs when opening the server socket.

  • Method Details

    • startNode

      public void startNode()
      Starts the miner node by opening server sockets for client and peer communications. Creates threads to handle incoming client and peer messages, and to manage block mining.

    • stopNode

      public void stopNode()
      Stops the miner node by closing server sockets and interrupting communication threads.

    • listenForIncomingPeerMessages

      private void listenForIncomingPeerMessages()
      Broadcasts a transaction to all peer nodes in the network.

    • handleIncomingPeerMessages

      private void handleIncomingPeerMessages(Socket peerSocket)
      Handles incoming messages from a peer node. Processes received blocks and responds to requests for the blockchain.
      Parameters:
      peerSocket - The socket for communication with the peer node.

    • listenForIncomingClientConnections

      private void listenForIncomingClientConnections()
      Listens for incoming client connections and handles client transactions.

    • handleClient

      private void handleClient(Socket clientSocket)
      Handles a client connection by reading a transaction from the client and adding it to the transaction pool.
      Parameters:
      clientSocket - The socket for communication with the client.

    • isValidTransaction

      private boolean isValidTransaction(String transaction)
      Checks if a transaction is valid by verifying that it is not null or empty and has not been added to the blockchain.
      Parameters:
      transaction - The transaction to validate.
      Returns:
      True if the transaction is valid, false otherwise.

    • processReceivedBlock

      private void processReceivedBlock(Block block)
      Processes a received block by validating it and adding it to the blockchain if it is valid. If the block is not valid, the node attempts to synchronize its chain with the peer that sent the block.
      Parameters:
      block - The block received from a peer node.

    • isValidChain

      public boolean isValidChain(List<Block> chain)
      Checks if a chain is valid by verifying that each block links to the previous block and has a valid hash.
      Parameters:
      chain - The chain to validate.
      Returns:
      True if the chain is valid, false otherwise.

    • fetchChainFromPeer

      private List<Block> fetchChainFromPeer(String peerAddress)
      Fetches the blockchain from a peer node by sending a request and receiving the chain in response.
      Parameters:
      peerAddress - The address of the peer node to fetch the blockchain from.
      Returns:
      The blockchain received from the peer node.

    • synchronizeChain

      private void synchronizeChain(Block block)
      Synchronizes the node's chain with a peer node's chain by comparing the lengths and work done on each chain. If the peer's chain is longer and has more work done, the node replaces its chain with the peer's chain.
      Parameters:
      block - The block received from the peer node.

    • broadcastNewBlock

      private void broadcastNewBlock(Block block)
      Broadcasts a new block to all peer nodes in the network.
      Parameters:
      block - The block to broadcast.

    • handleBlockChainCreation

      private void handleBlockChainCreation()
      Handles the creation of new blocks by mining transactions in the transaction pool.

    • updateTransactionPool

      public void updateTransactionPool()
      Updates the transaction pool by removing transactions that are included in blocks in the blockchain.
